title:
Regional Somali Forces 'Destroy' Islamic State Base|author=Mohamed Olad Hassan|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=19 December 2016|access-date=10 February 2017|archive-date=10 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171210021219/https://www.voanews.com/a/regional-somali-forces-destroy-islamic-state-base/3642109.html|url-status=live}}
({{Age in years, months, weeks and days|month1=10|day1=26|year1=2016|month2=12|day2=18|year2=2016}})}}

sentences.text: The '''Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State's activities in Puntland''' began in in the Galgala|Galgala region, in late 2015, when Abdul Qadir Mumin, a former prominent ideologue of Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabab, defected after becoming disillusioned with the group. He pledged allegiance to Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi along with a small band of followers. By 2017, Mumin's bay'ah was officially accepted by Territory of the Islamic State#Ministries|Islamic State leadership, and his faction in Puntland emerged as the most powerful and prominent Islamic State group in Somalia.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|url=http://jihadology.net/2015/10/22/new-audio-message-from-shaykh-abd-al-qadir-mu-min-bayah-from-him-and-a-group-of-mujahidin-of-somalia-to-the-caliph-of-the-muslims-abu-bakr-al-baghdadi/|title=New audio message from Shaykh 'Abd al-Qādir Mū 'min: "Bay'ah From Him and a Group of Mujāhidīn of Somalia to the Caliph of the Muslims Abū Bakr al-Baghdādī"|first=Aaron Y.|last=Zelin|date=22 October 2015|publisher=|access-date=3 January 2025|archive-date=14 December 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241214021415/https://jihadology.net/2015/10/22/new-audio-message-from-shaykh-abd-al-qadir-mu-min-bayah-from-him-and-a-group-of-mujahidin-of-somalia-to-the-caliph-of-the-muslims-abu-bakr-al-baghdadi/|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hummel |first=Kristina |date=2024-08-13 |title=The Death of an Islamic State Global Leader in Africa? |url=https://ctc.westpoint.edu/the-death-of-an-islamic-state-global-leader-in-africa/ |access-date=2025-02-07 |website=Combating Terrorism Center at West Point |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: Since the onset of the Islamic State in Puntland, it has engaged in numerous clashes with Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabab, Puntland Dervish Force|Puntland forces, and the United States Africa Command|United States' military. In 2016, the Islamic State took control of Qandala campaign|Qandala for nearly two months. In 2017, the group renewed a series of assassinations and IED attacks in Puntland. In 2018, heavy fighting broke out between the Islamic State and al-Shabab.  Despite this, the Islamic State continued to carry out IED attacks and assassinations in the region. In 2019, the Islamic State continued its campaign of assassinations and IED attacks. Puntland Forces also executed 5 al-Shabab and Islamic State militants. In 2020, Puntland began a campaign against the Islamic State with the help of the United States Africa Command|US military. The Islamic State claimed to have killed US troops. Despite this, the Islamic State continued to relatively operate normally and released two Mass media use by the Islamic State|videos showcasing a series of assassinations and executions of both Puntland and al-Shabab fighters, as well as a battle. In 2021, the Islamic State continued its usual operations, IED attacks and assassinations. In 2023, the Islamic State increased its activity, claiming responsibility for significant, high-profile attacks, mostly involving IEDs and assassinations. Skirmishes occurred with a coalition of American and Puntland forces. The Islamic State later released a video of an assault on its positions by both American and Puntland troops, stating it had repelled the assault, killing 9 and injuring dozens. The Islamic State also engaged in a few skirmishes with al-Shabab in 2023. On January 25th, Bilal al-Sudani was killed in a raid by SEAL Team Six|DEVGRU.

sentences.text: In November 2024, the semi-autonomous state of Puntland declared a Offensive (military)|major military offensive, led by the Puntland Security Forces, Puntland Dervish Forces,Puntland Maritime Police Forces, with support from the United States Africa Command, and the United Arab Emirates Air Force|United Arab Emirate Airforce against the Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State in the Bari, Somalia|Bari region. The operation was codenamed '''Puntland counter-terrorism operations|Hilaac Operation'''. This marked the first time that Puntland forces had launched a major military offensive on this scale since the Qandala campaign in 2016.

𝐗𝐈𝐃𝐃𝐈𝐆 |date=2024-11-30 |title=Puntland Plans Major Military Offensive Against ISIS in Bari and Sanaag Mountains |url=https://www.idilnews.com/puntland-plans-major-military-offensive-against-isis-in-bari-and-sanaag-mountains/ |access-date=2025-01-02 |website=Idil News |language=en-US |archive-date=2025-01-02 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250102171835/https://www.idilnews.com/puntland-plans-major-military-offensive-against-isis-in-bari-and-sanaag-mountains/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

content.title: Qandala taken over by Islamic State

sentences.text: On October 26, 2016, fighters aligned with the Islamic State captured the small port town of Qandala in Puntland's Bari, Somalia|Bari region. This was the first town Islamic State had taken control of in Somalia, the first notable expansion of their influence beyond their usual mountainous hideouts.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Gaffey |first=Conor |date=2016-10-26 |title=ISIS-Aligned Militants Seize Town in Somali Region |url=https://www.newsweek.com/somalia-isis-aligned-militants-seize-first-town-puntland-513890 |access-date=2025-01-02 |website=Newsweek |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-02 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250102214950/https://www.newsweek.com/somalia-isis-aligned-militants-seize-first-town-puntland-513890 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The takeover led to the displacement of over 25,700 civilians and the humanitarian impact of the conflict.

references.text: <ref name="reliefweb20161206">{{Cite web |date=2016-12-06 |title=OCHA Somalia Flash Update – Humanitarian impact of fighting in Qandala, Puntland {{!}} 6 December 2016 – Somalia {{!}} ReliefWeb |url=https://reliefweb.int/report/somalia/ocha-somalia-flash-update-humanitarian-impact-fighting-qandala-puntland-6-december |access-date=2025-01-02 |website=reliefweb.int |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250108144040/https://reliefweb.int/report/somalia/ocha-somalia-flash-update-humanitarian-impact-fighting-qandala-puntland-6-december |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text:
{{Main|Qandala campaign}}
Puntland Security Forces (PSF) launched a Counterattack|counter-offensive on December 3, 2016, which took aim at retaking Qandala. This operation involved both land and sea movements and faced resistance from Islamic State fighters, who had set up defenses around the town.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/world/islamic-state-aligned-group-takes-somali-town-say-officials-idUSKCN12Q0VZ/ | title=Islamic State-aligned group takes Somali town, say officials | work=Reuters | date=27 October 2016 | last1=Omar | first1=Feisal | last2=Sheikh | first2=Abdi }}</ref>

sentences.text: On December 7, 2016, Puntland forces successfully retook Qandala, with no resistance encountered as Islamic State had retreated to the mountainous areas south of the town.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2016-12-07 |title=Forces Retake Somali Town Held by Pro-Islamic State Fighters |url=https://www.voanews.com/a/forces-retake-somali-town-held-by-pro-islamic-state-fighters/3626738.html |access-date=2025-01-11 |website=Voice of America |language=en |archive-date=2019-04-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190413143906/https://www.voanews.com/a/forces-retake-somali-town-held-by-pro-islamic-state-fighters/3626738.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: After retaking Qandala, Puntland forces continued their operations into the nearby mountains, where they attacked and destroyed an Islamic State base at El Ladid on December 18, 2016. This was part of efforts to prevent Islamic State from regrouping.

references.text: <ref name=":3">{{Cite web |date=2016-12-19 |title=Regional Somali Forces 'Destroy' Islamic State Base |url=https://www.voanews.com/a/regional-somali-forces-destroy-islamic-state-base/3642109.html |access-date=2025-01-11 |website=Voice of America |language=en |archive-date=2024-09-30 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240930072311/https://www.voanews.com/a/regional-somali-forces-destroy-islamic-state-base/3642109.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

content.title: Puntland police arrested Islamic State members

sentences.text: On 26 June 2023, the Puntland Police Force arrested nine foreign individuals from Ethiopia, Sudan and Syria in Amaamo, Balidhidhin District|Balidhidin of the Bari, Somalia|Bari region and released their names.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-27 |title=Top ISIS Commander Among Suspects Apprehended in Puntland Anti-Terror Operations |url=https://thesomalidigest.com/top-isis-commander-among-suspects-apprehended-in-puntland-anti-terror-operations/ |access-date=2025-01-02 |website=The Somali Digest |archive-date=2025-01-02 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250102184412/https://thesomalidigest.com/top-isis-commander-among-suspects-apprehended-in-puntland-anti-terror-operations/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On the early morning of the 31st of December 2024, 12 Inghimasi|Inghimāsīyyūn from the Islamic State - Somalia Province|Islamic State attacked an amassing Puntland Dervish Force|Dervish force prepped for the Hilaac campaign. The assault began with a SVBIED|suicide vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (SVBIED) targeting the supply camp, causing both casualties and material damage. This was shortly followed by another SVBIED, which included two suicide bombers, targeting the main camp. After the initial explosions, the remaining Inghimasi|Inghimāsīyyūn began engaging Puntland Dervish Force|Puntland forces for several hours until they were eliminated. Puntland Dervish Force|Puntland forces said they had killed 8 fighters and had "foiled" the attack. Following the attack, multiple videos and images were released by reporters showing a collapsed building resulting from the SVBIED blasts, several burned-out vehicles, and the bodies of the Inghimasi|Islamic State fighters. Amaq News Agency|Amaq later released a report stating to have killed 20+ Puntland Dervish Force|Puntland forces and wounded over 10, and inflicted significant material damage, which aligned with what had been reported. Puntland's claim of foiling the attack was questioned by some security analysts, as the role of an Inghimasi|Inghimāsīy is to inflict as much damage as possible, expecting to be killed. Given that the Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State successfully achieved this objective, it could be seen that the Dharjaale assault was a victory for tIslamic State|he Islamic State. This attack was the first of its kind in terms of scale and sophistication for the Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State in Somalia, occurring just after Puntland announced a major offensive against both the Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State and Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab. Said Abdullahi Deni|President Said Abdullahi Deni has been actively involved, meeting with security officials in Bosaso to prepare for this campaign. The offensive is seen as part of a broader strategy to eliminate the Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State presence in the Outline of Puntland|region, with some implications for Islamic State operations in Western & Central Africa.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Wójcik |first=Paweł |date=December 2024 |title=Initial reports of the attack in Dharjaale |url=https://x.com/SaladinAlDronni/status/1874000874613444961 |website=X}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kaaman |first=Hugo |date=Jan 2025 |title=IS-Somalia carried out its most audacious attack ever yesterday |url=https://x.com/HKaaman/status/1874494841746591861}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2020-06-30 |title=Foreign Fighters Killed in Foiled ISIS Attack in Somalia's Puntland |url=https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/somalia/foreign-fighters-killed-in-foiled-isis-attack-in-somalia-s-puntland |access-date=2025-01-02 |website=Garowe Online |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-02 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250102025306/https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/somalia/foreign-fighters-killed-in-foiled-isis-attack-in-somalia-s-puntland |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hummel |first=Kristina |date=2024-09-11 |title=Islamic State-Somalia: A Growing Global Terror Concern |url=https://ctc.westpoint.edu/islamic-state-somalia-a-growing-global-terror-concern/ |access-date=2025-02-07 |website=Combating Terrorism Center at West Point |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: After the Islamic State attack, high-ranking officials, including members of the Task Force, Puntland Parliament|Puntland lawmakers, the Director of the Puntland Maritime Police Force, and presidential aides, were at the airport to manage the evacuation of the injured soldiers. The soldiers were flown out of Bosaso Airport to Ethiopia for medical care due to the complication of injuries resulting from the explosions. In addition to this, some of the wounded soldiers were given $30 in compensation.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=Jan 2025 |title=Soldiers wounded in the ISIS attack receive $30 from Puntland. |url=https://x.com/VancitySam/status/1875134667550281941 |url-status= |website=X}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-03 |title=Puntland Evacuates Injured Soldiers to Ethiopia After ISIS Attack |url=https://hornobserver.com/articles/3109/Puntland-Evacuates-Injured-Soldiers-to-Ethiopia-After-ISIS-Attack |access-date=2025-01-05 |website=hornobserver.com |language=English |archive-date=2025-01-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250105175858/https://hornobserver.com/articles/3109/Puntland-Evacuates-Injured-Soldiers-to-Ethiopia-After-ISIS-Attack |url-status=live }}</ref>

content.title: Islamic State mining gold in the Cal Miskaad mountains

sentences.text: Puntland officials said they are investigating how Islamic State uses gold mining in Cal-Miskaad of the Bari region to fund its activities. The group is mining gold and other resources in the mountains and taking advantage of the area's rich mineral deposits. Islamic State hires local workers for the mining operations. At the same time, people living in areas controlled by Islamic State are forced to pay money to avoid interference with their lives and work.<ref name=":0" />

references.text: <ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=2025-01-05 |title=ISIS Believed to Engage in Gold Mining in Puntland to Fund Its Activities |url=https://hornobserver.com/articles/3113/ISIS-Believed-to-Engage-in-Gold-Mining-in-Puntland-to-Fund-Its-Activities |access-date=2025-01-05 |website=hornobserver.com |language=English |archive-date=2025-01-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250105020336/https://hornobserver.com/articles/3113/ISIS-Believed-to-Engage-in-Gold-Mining-in-Puntland-to-Fund-Its-Activities |url-status=live }}</ref>

content.title: 2025 Puntland Military Offensive against the Islamic State militants in the Bari Mountains

sentences.text: On 8 January 2025, the Puntland armed forces greatly increased their fight against Islamic State militants in the Cal Miskaad|Al Miskat mountain range, located in the Bari, Somalia|Bari region. These forces said they are working to block all escape routes and are closing in on areas where the militants are hiding. Puntland's Counter-Terrorism Operation said their troops are surrounding the Al Miskat mountains and moving into the suspected hideouts. Security operations are also happening in nearby areas like Hamure. The security force is also talked to local people and asked them to not collaborate with the militants. They warned residents to stay away from the group before it was too late.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-08 |title=Puntland forces tighten noose around ISIS militants in Bari mountains |url=https://halqabsi.com/2025/01/puntland-forces-tighten-noose-around-isis-militants-in-bari-mountains/ |access-date=2025-01-10 |website=Halqabsi News |language=en-US |archive-date=2025-01-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250110184827/https://halqabsi.com/2025/01/puntland-forces-tighten-noose-around-isis-militants-in-bari-mountains/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On 9 January 2025, Puntland Security Force|Puntland forces carry out Drone warfare|drone strikes on Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State targets in the Cal Miskaad mountains near Balidhidhin District of Bari, Somalia|Bari, The counterterrorism claimed that they killed of several militants.

references.text: <ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-09 |title=Duqeymo ka dhacay degaano ka mid ah gobolka Bari |url=https://www.voasomali.com/a/duqeymo-ka-dhacay-degaano-ka-mid-ah-gobolka-bari/7931018.html |access-date=2025-01-10 |website=Voice of America |language=so}}</ref>

sentences.text: After the Drone warfare|aerial assaults, Puntland's counterterrorism forces captured four foreign Islamic State fighters from Ethiopia, Yemen, and Tanzania, while intercepting and destroying multiple Loitering munition|explosive-carrying drones in Bari region.<ref name=":2" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2020-06-30 |title=Islamic State Foreign Fighters Surrender in Somalia's Puntland Amid Offensive |url=https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/puntland/islamic-state-foreign-fighters-surrender-in-somalia-s-puntland-amid-offensive |access-date=2025-01-10 |website=Garowe Online |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250110021248/https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/puntland/islamic-state-foreign-fighters-surrender-in-somalia-s-puntland-amid-offensive |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On January 20, 2025, At least twenty people were killed, and over 10 others injured in two days of Laba-Afle battle between Islamic State militia members and Puntland armed forces near the Cal Miskat mountains of Bari region.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-21 |title=Wararkii ugu dambeeyey dagaalka ciidamada Puntland, iyo Daacish |url=https://www.voasomali.com/a/wararkii-ugu-dambeeyey-dagaalka-ciidamada-puntland-iyo-daacish-/7944594.html |access-date=2025-01-22 |website=Voice of America |language=so |archive-date=2025-01-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250121143414/https://www.voasomali.com/a/wararkii-ugu-dambeeyey-dagaalka-ciidamada-puntland-iyo-daacish-/7944594.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Puntland counterterrorism unit operation's spokesperson, Brigadier General Mohamud Mohamed Ahmed, reported that fifteen IS militants and six Puntland soldiers died during the Sunday and Monday fighting. He added that IS fighters used improvised explosive devices (IEDs) to defend their hideouts near Balidhidhin District|Balidhidin. A landmine explosion killed six soldiers and injured three others while they were clearing the area.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2020-06-30 |title=Somalia: Over 20 killed as Puntland forces battle Islamic State militants |url=https://www.garoweonline.com/en/news/somalia/somalia-over-20-killed-as-puntland-forces-battle-islamic-state-militants |access-date=2025-01-22 |website=Garowe Online |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-22 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250122141124/https://garoweonline.com/en/news/somalia/somalia-over-20-killed-as-puntland-forces-battle-islamic-state-militants |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Ahmed also mentioned that Puntland forces killed eight IS militants during the operation, which extended into Monday.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-21 |title=Over 20 killed in clash between security forces, Islamic State fighters in Somalia |url=https://www.voanews.com/a/over-20-killed-in-clash-between-security-forces-islamic-state-fighters-in-somalia/7944791.html |access-date=2025-01-22 |website=Voice of America |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-22 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250122015546/https://www.voanews.com/a/over-20-killed-in-clash-between-security-forces-islamic-state-fighters-in-somalia/7944791.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On 23 January 2025, Vice President of Puntland|Puntland Vice President Ilyas Osman Lugator|Ilyas Osman Lugatoor has accused President of Somalia|Somali President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud’s administration of obstructing the evacuation of war casualties in the fight against ISIS. Speaking on Thursday, Ilyas criticized the Federal Government of Somalia|federal government for hindering humanitarian operations instead of assisting Puntland’s counterterrorism efforts.

references.text: <ref name=":4">{{Cite web |last=Adinda |first=Charles |date=2025-01-23 |title=Puntland accuses Somali government of sabotaging anti-ISIS operation |url=https://eastleighvoice.co.ke/hassan%20sheikh%20mohamud/107761/puntland-accuses-somali-government-of-sabotaging-anti-isis-operation |access-date=2025-01-24 |website=The Eastleigh Voice News |language=en |archive-date=2025-01-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250124154116/https://eastleighvoice.co.ke/hassan%20sheikh%20mohamud/107761/puntland-accuses-somali-government-of-sabotaging-anti-isis-operation |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text:
* 1 January – Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State has publicly shared pictures of a suicide assault against Puntland, revealing that none of the attackers were Somali. The militants reported 12 perpetrators with nationalities and 7 country names. Included two Tanzanians, two natives of the Arabian Peninsula|Arabian peninsula, two Moroccans, and individuals from Libya, Tunisia, Yemen, and Ethiopia.
* 2 January – The Puntland armed forces claims to have conducted airstrikes on Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State hideouts in parts of the Cal Miskaad mountains of the Bari, Somalia|Bari region.
* 9 January – Puntland armed forces carried out airstrikes on Islamic State positions in mountain regions of the Balidhidhin District. They also carried out an operation in which they arrested four foreign fighters who originated from Ethiopia, Yemen, and Tanzania, and destroyed several explosives-laden drones.
* 10 January – Puntland Maritime Police Force|Puntland forces fight against Islamic State – Somalia Province|ISIS in the IL-Ameira mountains, stopping seven Loitering munition|drones loaded with bombs and removing ten landmines. The forces also destroy five ISIS bases. They capture military bases, including a water well in Jeceel Valley near Cal Miskaad mountains of Balidhidhin District, Bari, Somalia|Bari, Puntland.
* 11 January – The Counterterrorism Forces of Puntland's disclosed a cave that was being used to store food by ISIL was captured by Puntland forces in Cal Miskaad|Al-Miskad mountains, killed ISIL fighters and captured  including foreigners and destroyed improvised explosive devices and hideouts, and downed three explosives-laden drones as the troops continued their thunder offensive against ISIL militants hiding in the remote areas of the Bari, Somalia|Bari region, Puntland.
* 13 January – Twenty-six Islamic State – Somalia Province|ISIS militants are reported killed, including a female combatant and two soldiers, and several others are injured when Puntland forces capture eight ISIS bases during ongoing offensive military operations in Bari, Somalia|Bari.
* 15 January – Thousands of families are displaced as the military campaign intensifies, forcing locals to flee their homes in Bari region.
* 16 January – for the first time since the start of the campaign, the Islamic State dedicated a section to the conflict in Puntland in its weekly newspaper, al-Naba. Part of the article denied the Islamic State lost 20 men, and mocked the Puntland government by accusing it of fabricating 'Imaginary victories'.
* 22 January – Puntland mobilized a helicopter to support its current campaign against the Islamic State, aiding in Logistics|supply transport and medical evacuations in the state's rugged terrain. The aircraft will deliver essential supplies, including medicine, to frontline soldiers in naturally impassable areas. Officials have not disclosed the helicopter's origin.
* 23 January:
** Puntland authorities ban illegal foreign entries and direct telecom firms to deactivate SIM cards linked to undocumented individuals and Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State operatives, aiming to disrupt the group's financial networks amidst ongoing anti-IS offensives by Puntland Security Force|Puntland forces.
** Puntland's highest military court sentences two influencers to prison terms ''Trial in absentia|in absentia'' for promoting Islamic State propaganda and spreading disinformation intended at discrediting Puntland Dervish Force|Puntland forces' ongoing operations.
** At least four civilians are killed in an airstrike by an unknown Drone warfare|combat drone in the Sihan area of Qandala District|Qandala district in Puntland's Bari Region|Bari region.
* 24 January – at least thirteen Islamic State militants were killed in heavy fighting as Puntland forces claimed that they successfully took over the towns of Turmasaale and Janno-Jiifta in the Bari region.
* 29 January – Puntland deports around a thousand undocumented Ethiopians from Bosaso, Galkayo, Qardho and the state's capital, Garoowe, as part of an ongoing crackdown on foreigners without legal status, following the discovery of foreign fighters acting as Islamic State recruiters in the Cal Miskaad mountains.

sentences.text:
* 1 February – President of the United States|U.S. President Donald Trump orders the United States Armed Forces|military to carry out airstrikes against Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State positions in Somalia. Ten strikes targeted a series of cave systems used by the militant group.
* 2 February – Puntland military officials claimed that the U.S. airstrikes against the Islamic State – Somalia Province|Islamic State have killed 46 fighters in the Cal Miskaad|Al-Miskad mountains, a remote area in the Bari, Somalia|Bari Region.
* 3 February:
** Puntland Police Force|Puntland police spokesperson confirms that a senior commander of the Islamic State, Abdirahman Shirwac Aw-Said, the head of the group's assassination squad, surrendered to Puntland forces.
** Puntland Maritime Police Force seize a boat carrying Arms trafficking|illegal military supplies, Military uniform|uniforms and equipment. The vessel was taken captive off the coast of the Qaw|Qaw district in the Bari Region.
* 5 February – A deadly battle between the Puntland Security Force and Islamic State results in the killing of 57 foreign militants in Dharin area of Bari Region.
